author: IGN
description:
When you begin your adventure in Assassin’s Creed Shadows, you’ll be introduced to the game’s basic combat mechanics, but if you’d like to dive deeper, this guide is the perfect place to learn. Strap in and learn how to become a master of Expert Combat in Assassin’s Creed Shadows.

0:00 - Intro
0:38 - Core Combat Elements
3:53 - Helpful Tips
8:25 - Outro

#AssassinsCreedShadows #Gaming #IGN
title: Assassin’s Creed Shadows: Essential Tips to Perfecting Combat

author: IGN
description:
When attempting to create the best life for your brand-new Zoi, things can get costly. So just like in real life, getting a job is the most consistent way to make money that also lets Zois advance in a career path. Here's how to get a job in InZOI.

For more inZOI tips and tricks, check out our growing Wiki guide at https://www.ign.com/wikis/inzoi

#IGN #Gaming
title: InZOI - How to Get a Job

author: IGN
description:
There's a lot going on in Bleach: Rebirth of Souls. From Konpaku, to Hakugeki attacks, Kikon moves, Hoho Flash Steps, Chain Reverses, Reverse Bursts, and so on. It can be overwhelming even to someone who is up on their Bleach jargon, so if you're lost in the sauce, here's a guide covering everything you need to know about Bleach Rebirth of Souls' combat.

#IGN #Gaming
title: BLEACH: Rebirth of Souls - Essential Combat Tips You Need to Know

author: IGN
description:
Watch the 'Welcome to Redrock' Story Trailer for MindsEye, a narrative-driven action-adventure third-person shooter developed by Build A Rocket Boy. Explore a super-heated near-future desert metropolis where consumer robots carry out most manual tasks and an algorithm connects all-seeing devices. Become acquainted with characters interested in changing the course of human evolution and interact with fast-paced driving, intense combat gameplay, and more. MindsEye is launching on June 10 for PlayStation 5 (PS5), Xbox Series X|S, and PC (Steam).

#MindsEye #Gaming #IGN
title: MindsEye - Official 'Welcome to Redrock' Story Trailer

author: IGN
description:
Check out the 'A Minecraft Movie' DLC Trailer for Minecraft, a creative adventure game developed by Mojang. Players can enter the arcade solo or with friends to compete in elytra races, survive the night, and sneak into a woodland mansion to play iconic moments from the movie. Download the free DLC at the Minecraft Marketplace now.

#Minecraft #AMinecraftMovieDLC #Gaming
title: Minecraft - Official 'A Minecraft Movie' DLC Trailer

author: IGN
description:
Take a look at the Mortal Kombat Collaboration Trailer for Fortnite, the hit battle royale third-person shooter developed by Epic Games. Players will soon be able to access skins, abilities, and more from iconic fighters of the Mortal Kombat universe. Take revenge as Scorpion, become the eternal God of Thunder as Raiden, embody the warrior princess Katana, and more. New flawless Battle Royale mythic, locations, and more are launching on April 1 for Fortnite.

#Fortnite #MortalKombat #Gaming
title: Fortnite x Mortal Kombat - Official Collaboration Trailer

author: IGN
description:
The final Nintendo Switch 1 Direct just gave us our best look yet at Metroid Prime 4: Beyond—and it’s stunning. But here’s the big question: Is this actually a Switch 2 game? Join the NVC crew as they break down the new trailer, analyze Samus’ psychic abilities and the jungle planet Viewros, and debate whether this is a cross-gen release or a last-minute upgrade for Nintendo’s next console.

Plus, we’ll discuss why Metroid Prime 4’s long development cycle (and lack of a release date) has us suspicious. Is Nintendo holding it back for the Switch 2? Or is this truly the Switch 1’s final masterpiece?

#IGN #Gaming #Nintendo
title: Metroid Prime 4 Looks Great, and We’re Still Debating If It’s a Switch 2 Game - NVC Clips

author: IGN
description:
This video was originally posted on Eurogamer. Be sure subscribe to Eurogamer's YouTube channel to see more like this: @eurogamer 

Atomfall may well be the most British game ever made. You could call it Fallout: England, but that doesn't really do it justice: its influences are like a core sample of Britain's cultural bedrock, drawing on everything from ancient Celtic myths to Doctor Who. Cornish folk tales. Rationing. The very real Windscale nuclear disaster, the aftermath of which is still being dealt with today.
With authentic accents, and the correct usage of "'owt" and "nowt"! It's a far cry from the Dick Van Dyke London of Watch Dogs: Legion. Here's 8 reasons why Atomfall isn't Fallout England, but it is the most British game ever made.

Atomfall is the latest game from Rebellion, the studio behind the Sniper Elite series, which also owns a large number of British cultural institutions through their acquisition of Fleetway Publications. It's probably no surprise that the owner
title: Why Atomfall Is the Most British Game Ever Made
